title: Authors and Citation
text: Samuel Aeschbach. Author, maintainer. Dirk U. Wulff. Author. Rui Mata. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Aeschbach S, Wulff DU (2024). associatoR: Analyzing association data. R package version 0.1.0, https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=associatoR.
code: @Manual{,   title = {associatoR: Analyzing association data},   author = {Samuel Aeschbach and Dirk U. Wulff},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=associatoR}, }

title: Analyzing association data
text: Associations offer window semantics mind, revealing concepts words interconnected. interesting applications psychological theory also practical uses marketing research, sociology, education, artificial intelligence. associatoR R package work association data. offers pipelines import, normalize, process, analyze, convey results.

title: Analyzing association data
text: associatoR package developed Samuel Aeschbach Dirk U. Wulff.

title: Analyzing association data
text: latest development version GitHub can installed via devtools::install_github("samuelae/associatoR"). Note requires prior installation devtools package can achieved running install.packages("devtools") R.

title: Analyzing association data
text: prototypical workflow using functions associatoR package.
code: data %>%    ar_import(...) %>%    ar_set_targets(...) %>%    ar_embed(...) %>%    ar_plot(...)

title: Analyzing association data
text: Detailed descriptions can found package website. includes function reference.
code:
flowchart TD     DATA(free association data) --> IMPORT["ar_import()"]     IMPORT --> OBJ("associatoR Object 
 [cues, participants, responses]")     IMPORT --> NORM["ar_normalize()"] --> OBJ     IMPORT --> NORMM["ar_normalize_manual()"] --> OBJ      OBJ <--> SUB["ar_subset()"]      OBJ --> SET["ar_set_targets()"]      SET --> OBJT("associatoR Object 
 [cues, participants, responses, targets]")      OBJT <--> COUNT["ar_count_targets()"]     OBJT <--> CHAR["ar_characterize_targets()"]      OBJT --> EMBED["ar_embed()"]     EMBED --> OBJTE("associatoR Object 
 [cues, participants, responses, targets, target_embedding]")      OBJTE <--> PROJ["ar_project()"]      COMP["ar_compare()"]     OBJ <--> COMP     OBJT <--> COMP     OBJTE <--> COMP      CORR["ar_correlate()"]     OBJ <--> CORR     OBJT <--> CORR     OBJTE <--> CORR          PRINT["print(associatoR Object)"]     OBJ --> PRINT     OBJT --> PRINT     OBJTE --> PRINT      CSV["ar_write_csv()"]     OBJ --> CSV     OBJT --> CSV     OBJTE --> CSV

what: Characterize targets using additional resources — ar_characterize_targets
title: Characterize targets using additional resources — ar_characterize_targets
text: Append target characteristic targets table associatoR object. Specify characteristics manual look table.

title: Characterize targets using additional resources — ar_characterize_targets
code: ar_characterize_targets(   associations,   characteristics = c("valence", "arousal", "dominance", "concreteness", "frequency") )

title: Characterize targets using additional resources — ar_characterize_targets
text: associations associatoR object containing association data generated ar_import. characteristics character string vector specifying characteristics using one c("valence", "arousal", "dominance", "concreteness", "frequency") dataset containing characterisics. dataset must contain column word.

title: Characterize targets using additional resources — ar_characterize_targets
text: Returns associatoR object containing list tibbles, targets gaining additional columns including target characteristics: participants tibble participants including participant id potential participant attributes. cues tibble cues including cue variable potential cue attributes. responses tibble responses including participant id, cues, responses, response level, additional response attributes. targets tibble targets including specified analysis target, word characteristics

title: Characterize targets using additional resources — ar_characterize_targets
text: Data valence, arousal, dominance retrieved Warriner et al. (2013), concreteness frequency data retrieved Brysbaert et al. (2014).

title: Characterize targets using additional resources — ar_characterize_targets
text: Warriner, . B., Kuperman, V., & Brysbaert, M. (2013). Norms valence, arousal, dominance 13,915 English lemmas. Behavior Research Methods, 45(4), 1191–1207. https://doi.org/10.3758/s13428-012-0314-x Brysbaert, M., Warriner, . B., & Kuperman, V. (2014). Concreteness ratings 40 thousand generally known English word lemmas. Behavior Research Methods, 46(3), 904–911. https://doi.org/10.3758/s13428-013-0403-5

title: Characterize targets using additional resources — ar_characterize_targets
code: ar_import(fa_data,           participant = participantID, participant_vars = c(age, gender),           cue = cue, response = response,           response_vars = c("created_at", "pos")) %>%   ar_normalize() %>%   ar_set_targets("cues") %>%   ar_characterize_targets() #>  #> ── An associatoR object ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> participants #> # A tibble: 997 × 3 #>      id   age gender #>   <dbl> <dbl> <chr>  #> 1    77    34 Fe     #> 2   166    29 Fe     #> 3   223    31 Ma     #> 4   513    27 Fe     #> 5   577    20 Fe     #> # ℹ 992 more rows #>  #> cues #> # A tibble: 10 × 1 #>   cue        #>   <chr>      #> 1 she        #> 2 capital    #> 3 paper clip #> 4 recess     #> 5 neon       #> # ℹ 5 more rows #>  #> responses #> # A tibble: 3,000 × 5 #>      id cue   response created_at          pos   #>   <dbl> <chr> <chr>    <dttm>              <chr> #> 1    77 she   he       2011-08-15 04:15:38 R1    #> 2    77 she   is       2011-08-15 04:15:38 R2    #> 3    77 she   will     2011-08-15 04:15:38 R3    #> 4   166 she   her      2011-08-15 12:46:08 R1    #> 5   166 she   woman    2011-08-15 12:46:08 R2    #> # ℹ 2,995 more rows #>  #> targets #> # A tibble: 10 × 6 #>   target     valence arousal dominance concreteness frequency #>   <chr>        <dbl>   <dbl>     <dbl>        <dbl>     <dbl> #> 1 she          NA      NA        NA            3.36    190377 #> 2 capital       5.29    3.14      5.85         4.1        648 #> 3 paper clip   NA      NA        NA            4.79         0 #> 4 recess        6.57    4.15      5.32         3.07       178 #> 5 neon          6.48    4.56      5.62         4.07       146 #> # ℹ 5 more rows #>

title: Compare responses — ar_compare
text: ar_compare compares responses across participant variables.

title: Compare responses — ar_compare
code: ar_compare(   associations,   participant_vars,   target_var,   fun = c("count", "mean") )

title: Compare responses — ar_compare
text: associations associatoR object containing association data generated ar_import. participant_vars character vector specifying grouping variables. target_var optional character string specifying target variable summarized. specified ar_comapre tabulates frequencies targets. fun character string function specifying statistic calculate target_var.

title: Compare responses — ar_compare
text: Returns tibble containing grouped summaries (means, frequencies, custom statistics).

what: Correlate targets responses with participant variables — ar_correlate_targets
title: Correlate targets responses with participant variables — ar_correlate_targets
text: ar_correlate_targets calculates correlations response occurrence targets participant variables, gender age.

title: Correlate targets responses with participant variables — ar_correlate_targets
code: ar_correlate_targets(associations, participant_vars)

title: Correlate targets responses with participant variables — ar_correlate_targets
text: associations associatoR object containing association data generated ar_import. participant_vars character vector specifying participant variables assess. variables must exist associations$participants.

title: Correlate targets responses with participant variables — ar_correlate_targets
text: Returns associatoR object containing list tibbles, targets gaining frequency column: participants tibble participants including participant id potential participant attributes. cues tibble cues including cue variable potential cue attributes. responses tibble responses including participant id, cues, responses, response level, additional response attributes. targets tibble targets including specified analysis target

title: Correlate targets responses with participant variables — ar_correlate_targets
text: Function calculates point-biserial correlation numeric Cramer's V categorical participant_vars.

title: Correlate targets responses with participant variables — ar_correlate_targets
code: ar_import(risk_asso,           participant = id,           cue = cue,           response = response,           response_vars = trial,           participant_vars = c("gender", "age", "age_group")) %>%   ar_set_targets("cues") %>%   ar_correlate_targets(participant_vars = c("age", "gender")) #> Joining with `by = join_by(target)` #>  #> ── An associatoR object ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> participants #> # A tibble: 1,205 × 4 #>      id gender   age age_group #>   <dbl> <chr>  <dbl>     <dbl> #> 1     1 female    33         2 #> 2     2 male      56         4 #> 3     3 female    27         1 #> 4     4 male      66         5 #> 5     5 female    59         5 #> # ℹ 1,200 more rows #>  #> cues #> # A tibble: 1,439 × 1 #>   cue            #>   <chr>          #> 1 risiko         #> 2 wohnortwechsel #> 3 angst          #> 4 einschätzbar   #> 5 wetterchaos    #> # ℹ 1,434 more rows #>  #> responses #> # A tibble: 36,053 × 4 #>      id cue    response       trial #>   <dbl> <chr>  <chr>          <dbl> #> 1     1 risiko wohnortwechsel     1 #> 2     2 risiko angst              1 #> 3     3 risiko einschätzbar       1 #> 4     4 risiko wetterchaos        1 #> 5     5 risiko schwierigkeit      1 #> # ℹ 36,048 more rows #>  #> targets #> # A tibble: 1,439 × 3 #>   target         age_corr gender_corr #>   <chr>             <dbl>       <dbl> #> 1 risiko          -0.156       0.0169 #> 2 wohnortwechsel  -0.0256     -0.0288 #> 3 angst           -0.0709     -0.149  #> 4 einschätzbar    -0.0263     -0.0500 #> 5 wetterchaos      0.0317      0.0288 #> # ℹ 1,434 more rows #>

what: Count target occurences in responses — ar_count_targets
title: Count target occurences in responses — ar_count_targets
text: Append response frequency target targets table associatoR object.

title: Count target occurences in responses — ar_count_targets
code: ar_count_targets(associations, ...)

title: Count target occurences in responses — ar_count_targets
text: associations associatoR object containing association data generated ar_import. ... optional logical comparisons filtering responses computing frequencies.

title: Count target occurences in responses — ar_count_targets
text: Returns associatoR object containing list tibbles, targets gaining frequency column: participants tibble participants including participant id potential participant attributes. cues tibble cues including cue variable potential cue attributes. responses tibble responses including participant id, cues, responses, response level, additional response attributes. targets tibble targets including specified analysis target

title: Count target occurences in responses — ar_count_targets
code: ar_import(fa_data,           participant = participantID, participant_vars = c(age, gender),           cue = cue, response = response,           response_vars = c("created_at", "pos")) %>%   ar_normalize() %>%   ar_set_targets("responses") %>%   ar_count_targets() #>  #> ── An associatoR object ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> participants #> # A tibble: 997 × 3 #>      id   age gender #>   <dbl> <dbl> <chr>  #> 1    77    34 Fe     #> 2   166    29 Fe     #> 3   223    31 Ma     #> 4   513    27 Fe     #> 5   577    20 Fe     #> # ℹ 992 more rows #>  #> cues #> # A tibble: 10 × 1 #>   cue        #>   <chr>      #> 1 she        #> 2 capital    #> 3 paper clip #> 4 recess     #> 5 neon       #> # ℹ 5 more rows #>  #> responses #> # A tibble: 3,000 × 5 #>      id cue   response created_at          pos   #>   <dbl> <chr> <chr>    <dttm>              <chr> #> 1    77 she   he       2011-08-15 04:15:38 R1    #> 2    77 she   is       2011-08-15 04:15:38 R2    #> 3    77 she   will     2011-08-15 04:15:38 R3    #> 4   166 she   her      2011-08-15 12:46:08 R1    #> 5   166 she   woman    2011-08-15 12:46:08 R2    #> # ℹ 2,995 more rows #>  #> targets #> # A tibble: 1,042 × 2 #>   target frequency #>   <chr>      <dbl> #> 1 he            43 #> 2 is             7 #> 3 will           2 #> 4 her           42 #> 5 woman         29 #> # ℹ 1,037 more rows #>

title: Embed associations — ar_embed
text: ar_embed generates target embeddings.

title: Embed associations — ar_embed
code: ar_embed(   associations,   type = "ppmi-svd",   min_count = 5,   n_dim = 300,   model = NULL,   token = NULL,   context = NULL )

title: Embed associations — ar_embed
text: associations associatoR object including targets. type character specifying type embedding. One c("counts","ppmi","ppmi-svd","huggingface"). Default "ppmi-svd". min_count integer value specifying minimum response count responses considered embedding type = c("counts","ppmi","ppmi-svd"). Default 5. n_dim integer value specifying number dimensions generated type = "ppmi-svd". Default 300. model character specifying model label. Must match name huggingface.co/models. token character string specifying access token hugging face API. Must obtained huggingface.co/inference-api. context optional character string specifying common lead text may help language model interpret associations. Defaults "Free association: "

title: Embed associations — ar_embed
text: function returns associatoR object including new  matrix element called target_embeddings containing target embeddings.

title: Embed associations — ar_embed
text: Aeschbach, S., Mata, R., Wulff, D. U. (2024). associatoR. psyArXiv

title: Embed associations — ar_embed
code: ar_import(risk_asso, participant = id, cue = cue, response = response,           response_vars = trial, participant_vars = c(gender, age, age_group)) %>%   ar_normalize() %>%   ar_set_targets(targets = "responses") %>%   ar_embed() #> Warning: 915 cues with < min_count responses >= min_count were dropped from embedding. #>  #> ── An associatoR object ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> participants #> # A tibble: 1,205 × 4 #>      id gender   age age_group #>   <dbl> <chr>  <dbl>     <dbl> #> 1     1 female    33         2 #> 2     2 male      56         4 #> 3     3 female    27         1 #> 4     4 male      66         5 #> 5     5 female    59         5 #> # ℹ 1,200 more rows #>  #> cues #> # A tibble: 1,439 × 1 #>   cue            #>   <chr>          #> 1 risiko         #> 2 wohnortwechsel #> 3 angst          #> 4 einschätzbar   #> 5 wetterchaos    #> # ℹ 1,434 more rows #>  #> responses #> # A tibble: 36,053 × 4 #>      id cue    response       trial #>   <dbl> <chr>  <chr>          <dbl> #> 1     1 risiko wohnortwechsel     1 #> 2     2 risiko angst              1 #> 3     3 risiko einschätzbar       1 #> 4     4 risiko wetterchaos        1 #> 5     5 risiko schwierigkeit      1 #> # ℹ 36,048 more rows #>  #> targets #> # A tibble: 9,138 × 1 #>   target         #>   <chr>          #> 1 wohnortwechsel #> 2 angst          #> 3 einschätzbar   #> 4 wetterchaos    #> 5 schwierigkeit  #> # ℹ 9,133 more rows #>  #> target_embedding #> # A tibble: 518 × 301 #>   target       dim_1  dim_2  dim_3   dim_4   dim_5 dim_6  dim_7  dim_8 #>   <chr>        <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1 abenteuer   -8.01   4.47   4.57  -3.72   -7.34   3.54   1.98  -0.354 #> 2 abenteuerl… -0.810  0.577 -0.728 -0.0210 -1.67   1.28   1.33   1.62  #> 3 abenteuerl… -2.28   0.568  1.32  -0.574  -2.34   0.394  0.500  0.515 #> 4 abenteueru… -0.914  0.828  0.408  0.165  -1.45   0.640  0.543 -0.901 #> 5 abgabe      -1.33  -0.839 -0.541 -0.376   0.0865 1.03  -1.04  -0.151 #> # ℹ 513 more rows #> # ℹ 292 more variables: dim_9 <dbl>, dim_10 <dbl>, dim_11 <dbl>, #> #   dim_12 <dbl>, dim_13 <dbl>, dim_14 <dbl>, dim_15 <dbl>, #> #   dim_16 <dbl>, dim_17 <dbl>, dim_18 <dbl>, dim_19 <dbl>, #> #   dim_20 <dbl>, dim_21 <dbl>, dim_22 <dbl>, dim_23 <dbl>, #> #   dim_24 <dbl>, dim_25 <dbl>, dim_26 <dbl>, dim_27 <dbl>, #> #   dim_28 <dbl>, dim_29 <dbl>, dim_30 <dbl>, dim_31 <dbl>, … #>

what: Join all associatoR tibbles into one — ar_export_all
title: Join all associatoR tibbles into one — ar_export_all
text: Join associatoR tibbles one

title: Join all associatoR tibbles into one — ar_export_all
code: ar_export_all(associations)

title: Join all associatoR tibbles into one — ar_export_all
text: associations associatoR object containing association data generated ar_import.

title: Join all associatoR tibbles into one — ar_export_all
text: tibble containing joined data associations.

title: Import association data — ar_import
text: ar_import processes tabular association data associatoR object.

title: Import association data — ar_import
code: ar_import(   data,   participant,   cue,   response,   participant_vars = NULL,   cue_vars = NULL,   response_vars = NULL )

title: Import association data — ar_import
text: data data.frame tibble containing association data. participant variable name data identifying participants. cue variable name data character string identifying cue(s). response variable name data identifying responses. participant_vars optional variable names data identifying participant attributes (e.g., demographics). cue_vars optional variable names data identifying cue attributes. response_vars optional variable names data  identifying response attributes.

title: Import association data — ar_import
text: Returns associatoR object containing list tibbles: participants tibble participants including participant id potential participant attributes. cues tibble cues including cue variable potential cue attributes. responses tibble responses including participant id, cues, responses, response level, additional response attributes.

title: Import association data — ar_import
text: Aeschbach, S., Mata, R., Wulff, D. U. (progress)

title: Import association data — ar_import
code: ai_asso_imported <- ar_import(ai_asso,                               participant = id,                               cue = "AI",                               response = "association_correct",                               participant_vars = c("age", "gender", "use", "expertise"),                               response_vars = c("association", "trial"))

title: Normalize responses — ar_normalize
text: ar_normalize performs normalization steps responses (cues) wraps around ar_normalize_manual.

title: Normalize responses — ar_normalize
code: ar_normalize(   associations,   case = "lower",   punct = "end",   punct_replacement = " ",   whitespace = "squish",   process_cues = FALSE )

title: Normalize responses — ar_normalize
text: associations associatoR object containing association data generated ar_import. case character specifying normalization cases. Must one c("lower", "upper", "sentence"). Setting case = "lower" normalizes responses lower case, case = "lower" upper case, case = "sentence" sentence case. punct character specifying normalization punctuation. Must one c("end", ""). punct = "end" replaces punctuation end (including following whitespaces) punct_replacement (default single white space). punct = "" replaces punctuation. punct_replacement character used replacement punctuation. whitespace character specifying normalization white spaces. Must one c("squish", "trim"). Setting whitespace = "squish" removes additional white spaces start, end, -words, whereas setting whitespace = "trim" removes white space start end. process_cues logical specifying, cues processed well. Defaults FALSE.

title: Normalize responses — ar_normalize
text: Returns associatoR object containing list tibbles: participants tibble participants including participant id potential participant attributes. cues tibble cues including cue variable potential cue attributes. responses tibble responses including participant id, cues, responses, response level, additional response attributes.

title: Normalize responses — ar_normalize
text: Aeschbach, S., Mata, R., Wulff, D. U. (progress)

title: Normalize responses — ar_normalize
code: ar_import(ai_asso, participant = id, cue = "AI",           response = association_correct,           participant_vars = c(age, gender, use, expertise),           response_vars = c(trial)) %>%   ar_normalize(case = "lower", punct = "all") #>  #> ── An associatoR object ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> participants #> # A tibble: 500 × 5 #>      id   age gender   use expertise #>   <int> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl> #> 1     1    42      1     3         1 #> 2     3    54      1     9        10 #> 3     4    46      1     4         2 #> 4     5    53      2     8         7 #> 5     7    52      2     3         7 #> # ℹ 495 more rows #>  #> cues #> # A tibble: 1 × 1 #>   cue   #>   <chr> #> 1 AI    #>  #> responses #> # A tibble: 2,500 × 4 #>      id cue   response         trial #>   <int> <chr> <chr>            <dbl> #> 1     1 AI    robot                1 #> 2     1 AI    google               2 #> 3     1 AI    bing                 3 #> 4     1 AI    power to control     4 #> 5     1 AI    smart                5 #> # ℹ 2,495 more rows #>

title: Normalize responses manually — ar_normalize_manual
text: ar_normalize_manual offers interface add self-defined normalization steps responses (cues) associatoR objects.

title: Normalize responses manually — ar_normalize_manual
code: ar_normalize_manual(associations, fun, ..., process_cues = FALSE)

title: Normalize responses manually — ar_normalize_manual
text: associations associatoR object containing association data generated ar_import. fun vectorized function applied responses cues response matrix, excluding cues exist . ... additional arguments passed fun. process_cues logical indicating cues processed (.e. changed fun) .

title: Normalize responses manually — ar_normalize_manual
text: Returns associatoR object containing list tibbles: participants tibble participants including participant id potential participant attributes. cues tibble cues including cue variable potential cue attributes. responses tibble responses including participant id, cues, responses, response level, additional response attributes. responses passed fun

title: Normalize responses manually — ar_normalize_manual
text: Aeschbach, S., Mata, R., Wulff, D. U. (progress)

title: Normalize responses manually — ar_normalize_manual
code: ar_import(ai_asso, participant = id, cue = "AI",           response = association_correct,           participant_vars = c(age, gender, use, expertise),           response_vars = c(trial)) %>%   ar_normalize_manual(trimws, which = "left") #>  #> ── An associatoR object ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> participants #> # A tibble: 500 × 5 #>      id   age gender   use expertise #>   <int> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl> #> 1     1    42      1     3         1 #> 2     3    54      1     9        10 #> 3     4    46      1     4         2 #> 4     5    53      2     8         7 #> 5     7    52      2     3         7 #> # ℹ 495 more rows #>  #> cues #> # A tibble: 1 × 1 #>   cue   #>   <chr> #> 1 AI    #>  #> responses #> # A tibble: 2,500 × 4 #>      id cue   response         trial #>   <int> <chr> <chr>            <dbl> #> 1     1 AI    robot                1 #> 2     1 AI    Google               2 #> 3     1 AI    bing                 3 #> 4     1 AI    power to control     4 #> 5     1 AI    smart                5 #> # ℹ 2,495 more rows #>

title: Project embeddings — ar_project
text: ar_project generates 2D projection target embedding.

code: ar_project(associations, type = "umap", ...)

title: Project embeddings — ar_project
text: associations associatoR object including targets. type character specifying type projection. One c("mds", "umap"). Default "umap". ... additional parguments passed projection method.

title: Project embeddings — ar_project
text: function returns associatoR object  target_embeddings overwritten projected embeddings.

title: Project embeddings — ar_project
text: Aeschbach, S., Mata, R., Wulff, D. U. (2024). associatoR. psyArXiv

title: Project embeddings — ar_project
code: ar_import(risk_asso, participant = id, cue = cue, response = response,           response_vars = trial, participant_vars = c(gender, age, age_group)) %>%   ar_normalize() %>%   ar_set_targets(targets = "responses") %>%   ar_embed() %>%   ar_project() #> Warning: 915 cues with < min_count responses >= min_count were dropped from embedding. #>  #> ── An associatoR object ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> participants #> # A tibble: 1,205 × 4 #>      id gender   age age_group #>   <dbl> <chr>  <dbl>     <dbl> #> 1     1 female    33         2 #> 2     2 male      56         4 #> 3     3 female    27         1 #> 4     4 male      66         5 #> 5     5 female    59         5 #> # ℹ 1,200 more rows #>  #> cues #> # A tibble: 1,439 × 1 #>   cue            #>   <chr>          #> 1 risiko         #> 2 wohnortwechsel #> 3 angst          #> 4 einschätzbar   #> 5 wetterchaos    #> # ℹ 1,434 more rows #>  #> responses #> # A tibble: 36,053 × 4 #>      id cue    response       trial #>   <dbl> <chr>  <chr>          <dbl> #> 1     1 risiko wohnortwechsel     1 #> 2     2 risiko angst              1 #> 3     3 risiko einschätzbar       1 #> 4     4 risiko wetterchaos        1 #> 5     5 risiko schwierigkeit      1 #> # ℹ 36,048 more rows #>  #> targets #> # A tibble: 9,138 × 1 #>   target         #>   <chr>          #> 1 wohnortwechsel #> 2 angst          #> 3 einschätzbar   #> 4 wetterchaos    #> 5 schwierigkeit  #> # ℹ 9,133 more rows #>  #> target_embedding #> # A tibble: 518 × 3 #>   target                x      y #>   <chr>             <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1 abenteuer       -0.473  -0.874 #> 2 abenteuerlich    0.170   0.492 #> 3 abenteuerlustig -1.48    0.311 #> 4 abenteuerurlaub -0.0997  1.07  #> 5 abgabe           1.06    0.209 #> # ℹ 513 more rows #>

title: Set analysis targets — ar_set_targets
text: ar_set_target defines analysis targets (cues /responses).

title: Set analysis targets — ar_set_targets
code: ar_set_targets(associations, targets = c("cues", "responses"))

title: Set analysis targets — ar_set_targets
text: associations associatoR object containing association data generated ar_import. targets character containing either one c("cues","responses") gather targets columns vector manually selected targets.

title: Set analysis targets — ar_set_targets
text: Returns associatoR object containing list tibbles: participants tibble participants including participant id potential participant attributes. cues tibble cues including cue variable potential cue attributes. responses tibble responses including participant id, cues, responses, response level, additional response attributes. targets tibble targets including specified analysis target

title: Set analysis targets — ar_set_targets
code: ar_import(fa_data,           participant = participantID, participant_vars = c(age, gender),           cue = cue, response = response,           response_vars = c("created_at", "pos")) %>%   ar_normalize() %>%   ar_set_targets("responses") #>  #> ── An associatoR object ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> participants #> # A tibble: 997 × 3 #>      id   age gender #>   <dbl> <dbl> <chr>  #> 1    77    34 Fe     #> 2   166    29 Fe     #> 3   223    31 Ma     #> 4   513    27 Fe     #> 5   577    20 Fe     #> # ℹ 992 more rows #>  #> cues #> # A tibble: 10 × 1 #>   cue        #>   <chr>      #> 1 she        #> 2 capital    #> 3 paper clip #> 4 recess     #> 5 neon       #> # ℹ 5 more rows #>  #> responses #> # A tibble: 3,000 × 5 #>      id cue   response created_at          pos   #>   <dbl> <chr> <chr>    <dttm>              <chr> #> 1    77 she   he       2011-08-15 04:15:38 R1    #> 2    77 she   is       2011-08-15 04:15:38 R2    #> 3    77 she   will     2011-08-15 04:15:38 R3    #> 4   166 she   her      2011-08-15 12:46:08 R1    #> 5   166 she   woman    2011-08-15 12:46:08 R2    #> # ℹ 2,995 more rows #>  #> targets #> # A tibble: 1,042 × 1 #>   target #>   <chr>  #> 1 he     #> 2 is     #> 3 will   #> 4 her    #> 5 woman  #> # ℹ 1,037 more rows #>

title: Subset associations — ar_subset
text: Subset associatoR object.

title: Subset associations — ar_subset
code: ar_subset(associations, ...)

title: Subset associations — ar_subset
text: associations associatoR object containing association data generated ar_import. ... optional logical comparisons filtering responses computing frequencies.

title: Subset associations — ar_subset
text: Returns associatoR object containing list tibbles: participants tibble participants including participant id potential participant attributes. cues tibble cues including cue variable potential cue attributes. responses tibble responses including participant id, cues, responses, response level, additional response attributes.

title: Subset associations — ar_subset
text: Note subsets resets associatoR object. potential target tibble removed added using ar_set_target.

title: Subset associations — ar_subset
code: ar_import(fa_data,           participant = "participantID", participant_vars = c("age", "gender"),           cue = "cue", response = "response",           response_vars = c("created_at", "pos")) %>%   ar_subset(age > 25, gender == "Fe") #>  #> ── An associatoR object ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> participants #> # A tibble: 496 × 3 #>      id   age gender #>   <dbl> <dbl> <chr>  #> 1    77    34 Fe     #> 2   166    29 Fe     #> 3   513    27 Fe     #> 4   788    28 Fe     #> 5   897    54 Fe     #> # ℹ 491 more rows #>  #> cues #> # A tibble: 1 × 1 #>   cue   #>   <chr> #> 1 cue   #>  #> responses #> # A tibble: 1,494 × 5 #>      id cue   response created_at          pos   #>   <dbl> <chr> <chr>    <dttm>              <chr> #> 1    77 cue   he       2011-08-15 04:15:38 R1    #> 2    77 cue   is       2011-08-15 04:15:38 R2    #> 3    77 cue   will     2011-08-15 04:15:38 R3    #> 4   166 cue   her      2011-08-15 12:46:08 R1    #> 5   166 cue   woman    2011-08-15 12:46:08 R2    #> # ℹ 1,489 more rows #>

title: Write a csv file — ar_write_csv
text: ar_write_csv() joins data associatoR object (except potential target embedding) one table writes table disk using readr::write_csv().

title: Write a csv file — ar_write_csv
code: ar_write_csv(associations, file, ...)

title: Write a csv file — ar_write_csv
text: associations associatoR object containing association data generated ar_import. file character write . ... optional arguments passed readr::write_csv()

title: Write a csv file — ar_write_csv
text: ar_write_csv() returns joined associations tibble invisibly.

title: Write a csv file — ar_write_csv
code: ar_import(risk_asso, participant = id, cue = cue, response = response,           response_vars = trial, participant_vars = c(gender, age, age_group)) %>%  ar_normalize() %>%  ar_set_targets(targets = "responses") %>%  ar_write_csv(file = "associations.csv")
